0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Uncomplicated urinary tract infection, In women: a single 3 g dose mixed in 3 to 4 oz of water ORALLY with or without food

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Uncomplicated urinary tract infection, In women

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• bacterial overgrowth; risk of Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea
  • using more than one dose per acute cystitis episode; increased risk of adverse events

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Fosfomycin: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (9% to 10.4%), Nausea (4.1% to 5.2%)
  • Musculoskeletal:Backache (3%)
  • Neurologic:Headache (3.9% to 10.3%)
  • Reproductive:Dysmenorrhea (2.6%)
  • Respiratory:Pharyngitis (2.5%), Rhinitis (4.5%)
  • Other:Pain (2.2%)
Serious
  • Hematologic:Aplastic anemia (rare)
  • Hepatic:Cholestatic jaundice syndrome (rare), Hepatic necrosis (rare), Toxic megacolon (rare)
  • Other:Angioedema (rare)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Fosfomycin inactivates enolpyruvyl transferase, which irreversibly blocks the condensation of uridine diphosphate- N-acetylglucosamine with phosphoenopyruvate, and inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis. Fosfomycin also decreases the adherence of bacteria to epithelial cells of the urinary tract.

1.title: Distribution
1.mono:
• Protein binding: absent
  • Vd: 136.1 plus or minus 44.1 L

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Oral
  • pour sachet contents into 3 to 4 ounces of water and stir; do not use hot water
  • administer immediately after dissolving in water
  • take with or without food

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Drug may cause headaches, dizziness, diarrhea, nausea, stomach pain, dyspepsia, back pain, asthenia, or rash.
  • Advise patient to immediately report signs/symptoms of Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea (severe, watery, or bloody diarrhea).
  • Instruct patient to mix drug with water (not hot) before ingesting and to not ingest in dry form.
